intro: Discostigma rostratum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Tamaricaceae and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, woody fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Discostigma rostratum is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
